span.style: font-variant-ligatures: no-contextual; font-family: "Google Sans", Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 32px; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Four 8th grade students representing Dunmore Jr/Sr High School took home the Best Action Plan Award in the 3rd annual What’s So Cool About Manufacturing Northeast PA contest. The team members include Julianna Argust, Noah Dougherty, Quinn Healey, and Maura Michalczyk. Students visited Mitsubishi Advanced Chemicals in Scranton and assembled a video highlighting the work done there. The Dunmore video vied against videos from six other schools in the Northeast PA region. From this group, Dunmore students were recognized for writing the best Action Plan.

An Action Plan for this competition includes a step by step map of the students’ plan to gain votes from the community. Representing the 9 square miles that comprise the Dunmore School District, the students devised a plan that included asking for support from the district and Dunmore community. The eleven page action plan included emails to be sent to teachers, posters to be displayed throughout the schools asking students to vote, and social media posts requesting votes.
The students worked tirelessly on this project and thank the Dunmore School District administration, staff, and the Dunmore community for of all of their support. Go Bucks!
Hello,
This is John Marichak, Superintendent of the Dunmore School District.
This call is to remind everyone that by directive of the Pennsylvania Department of Education, we have transitioned to a formal planned instruction program.
We began the process on Monday, April 20, 2020.

This is no longer voluntary for students. They must attend and participate. Teachers take attendance and are reporting it to administration. Timelines may be attached to assignments and consequences may result from failure to participate or complete assigned work.
Attendance is constituted by checking in with their teachers, participation in work, activities and assignments required by our teachers.
New information/content/curriculum is be part of the lessons offered by our teachers.
This program will work best if there is a support structure within the home.

If there are any problems that you are experiencing, please work with your child’s teacher, administrator or this office. Problems may include access, technology, scheduling and so on. We have people in place to troubleshoot these issues.
Thank you for your attention to this matter.
More information may follow.
Please stay safe.
Thank You
John Marichak
Superintendent, Dunmore School District
Click HERE for the Dunmore School District Continuity of Education Plan

span.style: letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-size: 22px; font-variant-ligatures: no-contextual; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);

p.span: This is John Marichak, Superintendent of the Dunmore School District. I am calling to alert everyone that our playgrounds and athletic fields are now closed and off limits. This action is being taken to ensure everyone’s safety during to the Corona Virus pandemic. The Bucktown Trail and our track remain open for your use. We ask that you practice the proper social distancing protocols. Have a good day and please stay safe.
John Marichak

span.span: Click HERE for information on Special Services.
